00012 CScriptString::CScriptString()
00013 {
00014         // Count the first reference
00015         refCount = 1;
00016 }
00017 
00018 CScriptString::CScriptString(const char *s)
00019 {
00020         refCount = 1;
00021         buffer = s;
00022 }
00023 
00024 CScriptString::CScriptString(const string &s)
00025 {
00026         refCount = 1;
00027         buffer = s;
00028 }
00029 
00030 CScriptString::CScriptString(const CScriptString &s)
00031 {
00032         refCount = 1;
00033         buffer = s.buffer;
00034 }
00035 
00036 CScriptString::~CScriptString()
00037 {
00038         assert( refCount == 0 );
00039 }

00045 void CScriptString::AddRef()
00046 {
00047         refCount++;
00048 }

00050 static void StringAddRef_Generic(asIScriptGeneric *gen)
00051 {

00053         thisPointer->AddRef();

00056 void CScriptString::Release()
00057 {
00058         if( --refCount == 0 )
00059                 delete this;
00060 }

00072 CScriptString &CScriptString::operator=(const CScriptString &other)
00073 {
00074         // Copy only the buffer, not the reference counter
00075         buffer = other.buffer;
00076 
00077         // Return a reference to this object
00078         return *this;
00079 }

00082 {
00083         CScriptString *a = (CScriptString*)gen->GetArgAddress(0);

00118 {
00119         CScriptString *a = (CScriptString*)gen->GetArgAddress(0);

00121         CScriptString *out = *a + *b;
00122         gen->SetReturnAddress(out);

00389 //----------
00390 // string[]
00391 //----------
00392 
00393 static char *StringCharAt(unsigned int i, CScriptString &str)
00394 {
00395         if( i >= str.buffer.size() )
00396         {
00397                 // Set a script exception
00398                 asIScriptContext *ctx = asGetActiveContext();
00399                 ctx->SetException("Out of range");
00400 
00401                 // Return a null pointer
00402                 return 0;
00403         }
00404 
00405         return &str.buffer[i];
00406 }
00407 
00408 static void StringCharAt_Generic(asIScriptGeneric *gen)
00409 {
00410         unsigned int i = gen->GetArgDWord(0);
00411         CScriptString *str = (CScriptString*)gen->GetObject();
00412         char *ch = StringCharAt(i, *str);
00413         gen->SetReturnAddress(ch);
00414 }

00420 // This is the string factory that creates new strings for the script based on string literals
00421 static CScriptString *StringFactory(asUINT /*length*/, const char *s)
00422 {
00423         return new CScriptString(s);
00424 }
00425 
00426 static void StringFactory_Generic(asIScriptGeneric *gen)
00427 {
00428         asUINT length = gen->GetArgDWord(0);
00429         const char *s = (const char*)gen->GetArgAddress(1);
00430         CScriptString *str = StringFactory(length, s);
00431         gen->SetReturnAddress(str);
00432 }
00433 
00434 // This is the default string factory, that is responsible for creating empty string objects, e.g. when a variable is declared
00435 static CScriptString *StringDefaultFactory()
00436 {
00437         // Allocate and initialize with the default constructor
00438         return new CScriptString();
00439 }
00440 
00441 static CScriptString *StringCopyFactory(const CScriptString &other)
00442 {
00443         // Allocate and initialize with the copy constructor
00444         return new CScriptString(other);
00445 }
00446 
00447 static void StringDefaultFactory_Generic(asIScriptGeneric *gen)
00448 {
00449         *(CScriptString**)gen->GetReturnPointer() = StringDefaultFactory();
00450 }
00451 
00452 static void StringCopyFactory_Generic(asIScriptGeneric *gen)
00453 {
00454         CScriptString *other = (CScriptString *)gen->GetArgObject(0);
00455         *(CScriptString**)gen->GetReturnPointer() = StringCopyFactory(*other);
00456 }

00463     *(bool*)gen->GetReturnPointer() = r;

00512 
00513 // This is where we register the string type
00514 void RegisterScriptString_Native(asIScriptEngine *engine)
00515 {
00516         int r;
00517 
00518         // Register the type
00519         r = engine->RegisterObjectType("string", sizeof(CScriptString), asOBJ_REF); assert( r >= 0 );
00520 
00521         // Register the object operator overloads
00522         // Note: We don't have to register the destructor, since the object uses reference counting
00523         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_FACTORY,    "string @f()",                 asFUNCTION(StringDefaultFactory), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00524         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_FACTORY,    "string @f(const string &in)", asFUNCTION(StringCopyFactory), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00525         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADDREF,     "void f()",                    asMETHOD(CScriptString,AddRef), asCALL_THISCALL); assert( r >= 0 );
00526         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_RELEASE,    "void f()",                    asMETHOD(CScriptString,Release), asCALL_THISCALL); assert( r >= 0 );
00527         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ASSIGNMENT, "string &f(const string &in)", asMETHODPR(CScriptString, operator =, (const CScriptString&), CScriptString&), asCALL_THISCALL); assert( r >= 0 );
00528         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADD_ASSIGN, "string &f(const string &in)", asMETHODPR(CScriptString, operator+=, (const CScriptString&), CScriptString&), asCALL_THISCALL); assert( r >= 0 );
00529 
00530         // Register the factory to return a handle to a new string
00531         // Note: We must register the string factory after the basic behaviours,
00532         // otherwise the library will not allow the use of object handles for this type
00533         r = engine->RegisterStringFactory("string@", asFUNCTION(StringFactory), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00534 
00535         // Register the global operator overloads
00536         // Note: We can use std::string's methods directly because the
00537         // internal std::string is placed at the beginning of the class
00538         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_EQUAL,       "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTIONPR(operator==, (const string &, const string &), bool), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00539         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_NOTEQUAL,    "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTIONPR(operator!=, (const string &, const string &), bool), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00540         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_LEQUAL,      "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTIONPR(operator<=, (const string &, const string &), bool), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00541         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_GEQUAL,      "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTIONPR(operator>=, (const string &, const string &), bool), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00542         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_LESSTHAN,    "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTIONPR(operator <, (const string &, const string &), bool), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00543         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_GREATERTHAN, "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTIONPR(operator >, (const string &, const string &), bool), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00544         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(const string &in, const string &in)", asFUNCTIONPR(operator +, (const CScriptString &, const CScriptString &), CScriptString*), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00545 
00546         // Register the index operator, both as a mutator and as an inspector
00547         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_INDEX, "uint8 &f(uint)", asFUNCTION(StringCharAt), asCALL_CDECL_OBJLAST); assert( r >= 0 );
00548         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_INDEX, "const uint8 &f(uint) const", asFUNCTION(StringCharAt), asCALL_CDECL_OBJLAST); assert( r >= 0 );
00549 
00550         // Register the object methods
00551         r = engine->RegisterObjectMethod("string", "uint length() const", asMETHOD(string,size), asCALL_THISCALL); assert( r >= 0 );
00552 
00553     // TODO: Add factory  string(const string &in str, int repeatCount)
00554 
00555         // TODO: Add explicit type conversion via constructor and value cast
00556 
00557         // TODO: Add parseInt and parseDouble. Two versions, one without parameter, one with an outparm that returns the number of characters parsed.
00558 
00559         // Automatic conversion from values
00560         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ASSIGNMENT, "string &f(double)", asFUNCTION(AssignDoubleToString), asCALL_CDECL_OBJLAST); assert( r >= 0 );
00561         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADD_ASSIGN, "string &f(double)", asFUNCTION(AddAssignDoubleToString), asCALL_CDECL_OBJLAST); assert( r >= 0 );
00562         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(const string &in, double)", asFUNCTION(AddStringDouble), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00563         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(double, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(AddDoubleString), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00564 
00565         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ASSIGNMENT, "string &f(float)", asFUNCTION(AssignFloatToString), asCALL_CDECL_OBJLAST); assert( r >= 0 );
00566         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADD_ASSIGN, "string &f(float)", asFUNCTION(AddAssignFloatToString), asCALL_CDECL_OBJLAST); assert( r >= 0 );
00567         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(const string &in, float)", asFUNCTION(AddStringFloat), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00568         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(float, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(AddFloatString), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00569 
00570         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ASSIGNMENT, "string &f(int)", asFUNCTION(AssignIntToString), asCALL_CDECL_OBJLAST); assert( r >= 0 );
00571         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADD_ASSIGN, "string &f(int)", asFUNCTION(AddAssignIntToString), asCALL_CDECL_OBJLAST); assert( r >= 0 );
00572         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(const string &in, int)", asFUNCTION(AddStringInt), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00573         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(int, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(AddIntString), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00574 
00575         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ASSIGNMENT, "string &f(uint)", asFUNCTION(AssignUIntToString), asCALL_CDECL_OBJLAST); assert( r >= 0 );
00576         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADD_ASSIGN, "string &f(uint)", asFUNCTION(AddAssignUIntToString), asCALL_CDECL_OBJLAST); assert( r >= 0 );
00577         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(const string &in, uint)", asFUNCTION(AddStringUInt), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00578         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(uint, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(AddUIntString), asCALL_CDECL); assert( r >= 0 );
00579 }
00580 
00581 void RegisterScriptString_Generic(asIScriptEngine *engine)
00582 {
00583         int r;
00584 
00585         // Register the type
00586         r = engine->RegisterObjectType("string", sizeof(CScriptString), asOBJ_REF); assert( r >= 0 );
00587 
00588         // Register the object operator overloads
00589         // Note: We don't have to register the destructor, since the object uses reference counting
00590         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_FACTORY,    "string @f()",                 asFUNCTION(StringDefaultFactory_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00591         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_FACTORY,    "string @f(const string &in)", asFUNCTION(StringCopyFactory_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00592         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADDREF,     "void f()",                    asFUNCTION(StringAddRef_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00593         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_RELEASE,    "void f()",                    asFUNCTION(StringRelease_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00594         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ASSIGNMENT, "string &f(const string &in)", asFUNCTION(AssignString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00595         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADD_ASSIGN, "string &f(const string &in)", asFUNCTION(AddAssignString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00596 
00597         // Register the factory to return a handle to a new string
00598         // Note: We must register the string factory after the basic behaviours,
00599         // otherwise the library will not allow the use of object handles for this type
00600         r = engine->RegisterStringFactory("string@", asFUNCTION(StringFactory_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00601 
00602         // Register the global operator overloads
00603         // Note: We can use std::string's methods directly because the
00604         // internal std::string is placed at the beginning of the class
00605         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_EQUAL,       "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTION(StringEqual_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00606         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_NOTEQUAL,    "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTION(StringNotEqual_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00607         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_LEQUAL,      "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTION(StringLesserOrEqual_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00608         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_GEQUAL,      "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTION(StringGreaterOrEqual_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00609         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_LESSTHAN,    "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTION(StringLesser_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00610         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_GREATERTHAN, "bool f(const string &in, const string &in)",    asFUNCTION(StringGreater_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00611         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(const string &in, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(ConcatenateStrings_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00612 
00613         // Register the index operator, both as a mutator and as an inspector
00614         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_INDEX, "uint8 &f(uint)", asFUNCTION(StringCharAt_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00615         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_INDEX, "const uint8 &f(uint) const", asFUNCTION(StringCharAt_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00616 
00617         // Register the object methods
00618         r = engine->RegisterObjectMethod("string", "uint length() const", asFUNCTION(StringLength_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00619 
00620         // Automatic conversion from values
00621         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ASSIGNMENT, "string &f(double)", asFUNCTION(AssignDoubleToString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00622         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADD_ASSIGN, "string &f(double)", asFUNCTION(AddAssignDoubleToString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00623         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(const string &in, double)", asFUNCTION(AddStringDouble_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00624         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(double, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(AddDoubleString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00625 
00626         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ASSIGNMENT, "string &f(float)", asFUNCTION(AssignFloatToString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00627         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADD_ASSIGN, "string &f(float)", asFUNCTION(AddAssignFloatToString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00628         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(const string &in, float)", asFUNCTION(AddStringFloat_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00629         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(float, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(AddFloatString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00630 
00631         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ASSIGNMENT, "string &f(int)", asFUNCTION(AssignIntToString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00632         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADD_ASSIGN, "string &f(int)", asFUNCTION(AddAssignIntToString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00633         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(const string &in, int)", asFUNCTION(AddStringInt_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00634         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(int, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(AddIntString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00635 
00636         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ASSIGNMENT, "string &f(uint)", asFUNCTION(AssignUIntToString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00637         r = engine->RegisterObjectBehaviour("string", asBEHAVE_ADD_ASSIGN, "string &f(uint)", asFUNCTION(AddAssignUIntToString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00638         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(const string &in, uint)", asFUNCTION(AddStringUInt_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00639         r = engine->RegisterGlobalBehaviour(asBEHAVE_ADD,         "string@ f(uint, const string &in)", asFUNCTION(AddUIntString_Generic), asCALL_GENERIC); assert( r >= 0 );
00640 }
00641 
00642 void RegisterScriptString(asIScriptEngine *engine)
00643 {
00644         if( strstr(asGetLibraryOptions(), "AS_MAX_PORTABILITY") )
00645                 RegisterScriptString_Generic(engine);
00646         else
00647                 RegisterScriptString_Native(engine);
00648 }
